content: Pro wrestling promotion in Singapore **Singapore Pro Wrestling**, commonly shortened to **SPW**, is a [professional wrestling](/wiki/Professional_wrestling) promotion based in [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore). It was the first modern professional wrestling promotion in [Southeast Asia](/wiki/Southeast_Asia), and was founded by [Andruew Tang](/wiki/Andruew_Tang) (known as "The Statement" Andruew Tang in SPW), the first Singaporean professional wrestler, and Vadim Koryagin, in February 2012. The promotion also has a wrestling school, in which Andruew Tang is the head coach, and SPW wrestlers, Aiden Rex, Dr. Gore, [Alexis Lee](/wiki/Alexis_Lee) and [Da Butcherman](/wiki/Da_Butcherman) work as assistant coaches. SPW is best known for producing [Dante Chen](/wiki/Dante_Chen) (known as "Trexxus" during his time in SPW), the first wrestler from Southeast Asia to sign with [WWE](/wiki/WWE), making his debut on [WWE NXT](/wiki/WWE_NXT), on 22 September 2021. ## History ### Early years (2011–2014) In 2011, Andruew Tang, an aspiring Singaporean professional wrestler, would attend a talk by Vadim Koryagin, a Russian businessman and owner of [Independent Wrestling Federation (IWF)](/wiki/Independent_Wrestling_Federation_(Russia)), a Russia-based promotion, established in 2002. Together the two would form the nation's first pro wrestling promotion, Singapore Pro Wrestling in February 2012. They would begin to train the first generation of Singaporean professional wrestlers, including Tang, who would become ["The Statement" Andruew Tang](/wiki/%22The_Statement%22_Andruew_Tang), Singapore's first professional wrestler and [Kaiser Trexxus](/wiki/Dante_Chen), who would become the first Singaporean in the WWE, through Vadim's coaching and expertise. SPW faced difficulties in the beginning, with many people doubting the promotion, and believing that Singaporeans "were too small". In the beginning some of their wrestlers would appear in IWF shows, but later on they would host live shows in Singapore, beginning to gain an audience. SPW would develop more regular talent, including Dr. Gore and The Eurasian Dragon, and eventually Tang and Trexxus would become trainers, after honing their talents. In 2014, SPW would grow to a size that they were able to host international talent including [Johnny Gargano](/wiki/Johnny_Gargano) and [Sonjay Dutt](/wiki/Sonjay_Dutt). ### Growth and expansion (2015–2019) A major turning point for SPW, was when they hosted a show a day before the 2015 [WWE Live](/wiki/WWE_Live) Event at the [Singapore Indoor Stadium](/wiki/Singapore_Indoor_Stadium), which sold out completely. SPW would inaugurate their first title, the Southeast Asian Championship in 2015, with their first champion being ["The Statement" Andruew Tang](/wiki/%22The_Statement%22_Andruew_Tang). SPW would host foreign talent, including [IWF](/wiki/Independent_Wrestling_Federation) wrestler, [Lokomotiv](/wiki/Ivan_Markov_(wrestler)) and [DDT](/wiki/DDT_Pro-Wrestling) wrestler, [Masa Takanashi](/wiki/Masa_Takanashi), who would help the promotion grow, each winning the Southeast Asian championship. In the next year SPW would add three more titles to the promotion, the Queen of Asia, Tag Team and Singapore championships. In 2017, [Rene Dupree](/wiki/Rene_Dupree) would debut in SPW, facing Tang. Later that year, [NXT UK](/wiki/NXT_UK) Champion, at that time, [Pete Dunne](/wiki/Pete_Dunne) would debut in the company and face Tang in a singles match. SPW would continue to grow, developing local talent such as Alexis Lee (who would be called for a WWE tryout along with The Statement and Kaiser Trexxus), bodybuilder and the 2016 Mr. Singapore, [Danie "Destroyer" Dharma](/wiki/Danie_Dharma), [Da Butcherman](/wiki/Da_Butcherman), Big T, BGJ and Aiden Rex, who would all win various championships in the SPW promotion. In 2018, SPW would host its first all female event, titled Ladies Night. The main event of this show would feature [Riho](/wiki/Riho) facing [Makoto](/wiki/Makoto_(wrestler)), which would become SPWs most viewed match ever. In 2019, globally-known [AEW](/wiki/AEW) wrestler, [Kenny Omega](/wiki/Kenny_Omega), would also debut in the promotion, participating in a 3 on 3 tag match. [Tajiri](/wiki/Yoshihiro_Tajiri) would make his SPW debut in 2019, defeating Tang. SPW would grow to have over 10,000 subscribers on YouTube, and over 10,000 followers on Instagram and Facebook combined. ### Covid-19 and return (2020–present) SPW hosted its last show of 2020, No Guts No Glory, in February, featuring then [NXT UK Women's Champion](/wiki/NXT_UK_Women%27s_Champion), [Meiko Satomura](/wiki/Meiko_Satomura) and [Dash Chisako](/wiki/Dash_Chisako) in the main event. During the [COVID-19 pandemic](/wiki/COVID-19_pandemic), SPW produced two seasons of an in-house show, called SPW Prove: Alive and Kicking and SPW Prove: It's A Slamdemic. During the first season of Prove, The Statement would retire [Kaiser Trexxus](/wiki/Dante_Chen) from the promotion, who would leave to [WWE NXT](/wiki/WWE_NXT) and debut as [Dante Chen](/wiki/Dante_Chen). Their second season was cut short as restrictions were lifted and SPW returned to a live show format, with their first private live show back on 15 April 2022, SPW: Sembawang Showdown, a private event for [migrant workers of Singapore.](/wiki/Migrant_workers_in_Singapore) SPW hosted their first public live show, SPW: Homecoming on 27 May 2022, that sold out in a few days. In July, SPW had their second public event of the year, SPW: Battlefront. In September, SPW would announce its partnership with *Nothing But Cheese Burger* to introduce the promotions 5th title, The NBCB Championship, a 24/7 championship. In November 2022, SPW hosted its 10th anniversary show, featuring the return of [Riho](/wiki/Riho), [Tajiri](/wiki/Yoshihiro_Tajiri), [Masa Takanashi](/wiki/Masa_Takanashi), [HoHo Lun](/wiki/Ho_Ho_Lun) and the debut of [Chris Brookes](/wiki/Chris_Brookes) and [Mei Suruga](/wiki/Mei_Suruga), SPW X: Astronomical Anniversary. ## Roster Ring nameReal nameNotesAiden Rex*Unknown*[Alexis Lee](/wiki/Alexis_Lee)Lee Xin YiSPW Queen of Asia ChampionBGJ*Unknown*SPW Southeast Asian Tag Team ChampionBlack ArrowKamalrajBryson Blade*Unknown*Carl HellaJoel Sam ThomasGeneral ManagerCBK*Unknown*SPW Southeast Asian Tag Team ChampionCK VinAlvin HoSPW Singapore Champion[Da Butcherman](/wiki/Da_Butcherman)Danial AliasDarren 'Yam Seng' ChuaDarren ChuaRing Announcer[Destroyer Dharma](/wiki/Danie_Dharma)Danie DharmaDr. GoreCaleb TanEmman*Unknown*Kentona*Unknown*Kyle "The Trickster" BlackKeeran Broysten"Mad Kat" Karina*Unknown*Mason*Unknown*Mighty MightyMohammed TaufikSelina*Unknown*Mr. Frois*Unknown*Ring AnnouncerRayRay LimReferee Pritish*Unknown*RefereeReferee Sodiq*Unknown*RefereeRiky Malek*Unknown*RizRizRJ*Unknown*Ryan Shen*Unknown*SPW Hardcore ChampionSayn RH*Unknown*["The Statement" Andruew Tang](/wiki/%22The_Statement%22_Andruew_Tang)Andruew Tang You LiangCo-founder / Promoter ### Notable alumni/guests - [Pete Dunne](/wiki/Pete_Dunne) - [Reika Saiki](/wiki/Reika_Saiki) - [Rene Dupree](/wiki/Rene_Dupree) - [Riho](/wiki/Riho) - [Saki Akai](/wiki/Saki_Akai) - [Shaukat](/wiki/Shaukat_(wrestler)) - Shazza McKenzie - Shivam - [Shun Skywalker](/wiki/Shun_Skywalker) - [Sonjay Dutt](/wiki/Sonjay_Dutt) - Sultan Singh - [Susumu Yokosuka](/wiki/Susumu_Yokosuka) - [Tajiri](/wiki/Yoshihiro_Tajiri) - [Yoshi Tatsu](/wiki/Yoshi_Tatsu) - [Yuki Kamifuku](/wiki/Yuki_Kamifuku) - [Yukio Sakaguchi](/wiki/Yukio_Sakaguchi) - [T-Hawk](/wiki/T-Hawk_(wrestler)) - [Trent Seven](/wiki/Trent_Seven) - [Wolfgang](/wiki/Wolfgang_(wrestler)) - [Zeda Zhang](/wiki/Zeda_Zhang) ## Progression of champions ### SPW Southeast Asian Championship The **SPW Southeast Asian Championship** is the regional championship, and the primary and most prestigious title of the Singapore Pro Wrestling promotion. There have been a total of 10 reigns shared between 6 different champions. The current champion is [Da Butcherman](/wiki/Da_Butcherman), who won the title for the first time on 8 November 2024. Tang was also the inaugural champion, and is the only wrestler to have held the title more than once. Tang has the record for having the record for the longest reign at 826 days and the most reigns at 5. On 9 February, Shaukat was forced to relinquish his title due to a concussion.8["The Statement" Andruew Tang](/wiki/%22The_Statement%22_Andruew_Tang)21 February 2020*SPW No Guts No Glory*The Pavillion, [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore)4826This match was against JY Eagle for the newly vacant SEA championship. Tang's reign is the longest in the history of this title. However, his reign was elongated due to the [COVID-19 pandemic](/wiki/COVID-19_pandemic).9Aiden Rex27 May 2022*SPW Homecoming*Federation of Chinese Clan Associations, [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore)1721This match happened at the first public live show after the Covid-19 pandemic, concluding a storyline that was teased in early 2020, and naturally delayed due to the coronavirus.10["The Statement" Andruew Tang](/wiki/%22The_Statement%22_Andruew_Tang)17 May 2024*SPW Ignition*Futsing Association Building, [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore)517511[Da Butcherman](/wiki/Da_Butcherman)8 November 2024SPW Crowning GloryFoochow Building, [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore)1427+12[Tetsuya Naito](/wiki/Tetsuya_Naito)28 November 2025SPW TranquilloFoochow Building, [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore)142+ ### SPW Singapore Championship The **SPW Singapore Championship** is the national championship and the secondary title of the Singapore Pro Wrestling promotion. There have been a total of six reigns. The current champion is CK Vin, who won the title for the first time on 8 November 2024. The inaugural champion was the Eurasian Dragon who won the belt in 2016. [Da Butcherman](/wiki/Da_Butcherman) holds the record for the longest reigning Singapore Champion at 1098 days. Black Arrow holds the record for most reigns at 2. OWE: Oriental Storm, it was revealed that Arsenal Affi had to relinquish the title due to personal reasons.5[Destroyer Dharma](/wiki/Danie_Dharma)25 July 2019*SPW Vs. Dharma won the title on his 33rd birthday.6[Da Butcherman](/wiki/Da_Butcherman)23 November 2019*SPW Into The Mist*The Pavillion, [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore)11,098Da Butcherman's reign is the longest in the history of this title and any of the titles in the SPW promotion. However, his reign was elongated due to the [COVID-19 pandemic](/wiki/COVID-19_pandemic).7Black Arrow25 November 2022*SPW X: Astronomical Anniversary Day 2*Foochow Building, [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore)1266This was a [three-way match](/wiki/Professional_wrestling_match_types) also involving Big T.8Shivam18 August 2023*SPW Valour*Foochow Building, [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore)1154This was a [three-way match](/wiki/Professional_wrestling_match_types) also involving Monomoth.9Black Arrow19 January 2024*SPW Champions Never Yield 2*Foochow Building, [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore)2294Black Arrow defeated Shivam to become the only person to ever hold the Singapore championship twice.10CK Vin8 November 2024SPW Crowning GloryFoochow Building, [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore)1427+CK Vin cashed in his number one contendership contract, pinning Black Arrow during his four-way match with Carlo Cannon, Dr. Gore and Ho Ho Lun. ### SPW Queen of Asia Championship The **SPW Queen of Asia Championship** is the women's title of the Singapore Pro Wrestling promotion. The current champion is [Alexis Lee](/wiki/Alexis_Lee) who won the championship on the 25th of November, 2022. Kasey was the first champion and [Riho](/wiki/Riho) holds the record for longest reign at 1307 days. Key No.Overall reign numberReignReign number for the specific championDaysNumber of days held<1Reign lasted less than a day+Current reign is changing dailyNo.ChampionChampionship changeReign statisticsNotesRef.DateEventLocationReignDays1 Kasey9 December 2017*SPW Wrestle The Odds III*[Toa Payoh](/wiki/Toa_Payoh), [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore)1252Defeated [Alexis Lee](/wiki/Alexis_Lee) and Crystal in a [three-way match](/wiki/Three-way_match) to become the inaugural champion.2 Jibzy18 August 2018*WrestlingCity.Asia : One Night in Bangkok*[Bangkok](/wiki/Bangkok), [Thailand](/wiki/Thailand)169This was a [four-way match](/wiki/Four-way_match), also involving [Alexis Lee](/wiki/Alexis_Lee) and [Emi Sakura](/wiki/Emi_Sakura).3[Riho](/wiki/Riho)26 October 2018*SPW Triple Thrill Extra: Unfinished Business - SPW Vs. Land's End*[Singapore](/wiki/Singapore)11,491After Riho won the title she would successfully defend it multiple times. However, in late 2019, she signed with [All Elite Wrestling](/wiki/All_Elite_Wrestling) (AEW) where she would become their inaugural [women's champion](/wiki/AEW_Women%27s_World_Championship). Due to this, Riho was unable to defend the SPW Queen of Asia Championship until November of 2022, where she would lose to [Alexis Lee](/wiki/Alexis_Lee).4[Alexis Lee](/wiki/Alexis_Lee)25 November 2022*SPW X: Astronomical Anniversary Day 2*Foochow Building, [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore)1364This was a [three-way match](/wiki/Three-way_match), also involving [Mei Suruga](/wiki/Mei_Suruga).5[Yuki Kamifuku](/wiki/Yuki_Kamifuku)24 November 2023*SPW Viva La Lucha*Foochow Building, [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore)15536[Alexis Lee](/wiki/Alexis_Lee)30 May 2025*SPW Mayhem*Foochow Building, [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore)2224+ ### SPW Southeast Asian Tag Team Championships The **SPW Southeast Asian Tag Team Championship** are the [tag team](/wiki/Tag_team) titles of the Singapore Pro Wrestling promotion. The title is currently held by CBK and BGJ, Jack 'N' Cheese. Onslaught, the duo of Andruew Tang and Trexxus were the first champions, and the duo of [Alexis Lee](/wiki/Alexis_Lee) and Nyc are the longest reigning champions at 485 days. This title has been vacated on three separate occasions. title: Singapore Pro Wrestling
